messageBody:
Thanks for the thoughtful replies, folks! I'll check out CPsuite and TestNG.


David Saff wrote:
> We've made a couple passes at a built-in grouping system in the past,
> but our first couple passes didn't seem to fit in well with the rest
> of the design. Looking at the code now, it looks like a much easier
> feature, perhaps for early 4.8.
>
> Question: would you rather see the tests as ignored, or not see them at all?
>

I'm glad to hear you folks are aiming to support this use case!

I could see people wanting both behaviors. In my case, I don't want to
see them at all.

The problem I'm trying to address is that this project recently added a
database to the mix, so a small number of tests have increased AllTests
running time by 20x. Developers now run the tests a lot less. I want to
give them a single FastTests target to run that gets everything except
ones I've marked as slow.

On previous projects, I've also tagged tests that depend on particular
shared resources, like some common app server or database, or an
external, not-always-reliable test server. For those, I'd lean more
toward being able to ignore them, as turning them off would be temporary.

William
